text: Anton Ledermaier is an Austrian para-alpine skier. He represented Austria at the 1976 Winter Paralympics and at the 1980 Winter Paralympics. His win at the 1980 Slalom 2B event formed part of a medal sweep as Gerhard Langer and Anton Berger, both representing Austria as well, won the gold and silver medals respectively. == Achievements == {| class="wikitable" width=65% style="font- size:90%; text-align:center;" |- !Year !!Competition !!Location !!Position !!Event !!Time |- | 1976 | 1976 Winter Paralympics | Örnsköldsvik, Sweden | bgcolor=cc9966 | 3rd | Giant Slalom IV A | 3:45.88 |- | 1980 | 1980 Winter Paralympics | Geilo, Norway | bgcolor=cc9966 | 3rd | Slalom 2B | 2:01.86 |} == See also == * List of Paralympic medalists in alpine skiing == References == == External links == * Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Place of birth missing (living people) Category:Paralympic alpine skiers of Austria Category:Alpine skiers at the 1976 Winter Paralympics Category:Alpine skiers at the 1980 Winter Paralympics Category:Medalists at the 1976 Winter Paralympics Category:Medalists at the 1980 Winter Paralympics Category:Paralympic bronze medalists for Austria Category:Paralympic medalists in alpine skiing
title: Anton Ledermaier
